definition: good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: Good people and good deeds can be found everywhere.
There are many instances of good people and good deeds in our factory.
sentences.chinese: 我們廠裏，好人好事的例子很多。

sentences.english: Kings and cabbages perish, but good deeds live on.
sentences.chinese: 國王會死，捲心菜會爛，好人好事永遠流傳。

sentences.english: There are many instances of good people and good deeds nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 現在好人好事的例子很多。

definition: to pick up money and not hide it (idiom); to return property to its owner
to see what is right and act courageously (idiom, from Analects); to stand up bravely for the truth/acting heroically in a just cause
Lei Feng (1940-1962), made into a model of altruism and dedication to the Party by propaganda from 1963 onwards
to abandon self for others (idiom); to sacrifice oneself to help the people/altruism
to help the poor/almsgiving for the needy/to assist poor households or poor regions
deed/past achievement/important event of the past
respect the old and cherish the young
